info.name: Webhook UAT
info.description: As an API platform , this service will provide standard webhook notification interface to the developers on the platform so that they can subscribe their apps to and receive updates on various events without requiring to build a tightly coupled integration with our Kafka stream. This swagger documentation provides all Webhook Notification Service API details.

header.description: (Required) App Id of the app which wants to either publish events or subscribe to specific events. App should be registered with Dev portal, you will get this id there. e.g. app:9694716b-f563-46cc-9cc8-255873f28553.
(Required) User info header having JSON stringified object having following properties {"appId", "name", "id"}

request.description:
Register the app configurations.
### **Permissions**: 
Permissions are the access rights needed to control who can do what within the app. This list specifies the permissions required to access particular resources. 
                
For instance, if your app exposes User-related events and provides an API for fetching user details at '/api/v1/users/:userId', the permissions necessary to access this endpoint should be added here. You can find them in your app's AAA YAML. 
                
Subscribers who want to receive events from this app must have at least one of the role that includes these listed permissions. This will be used to control only authorized apps are able to subscribe to your events.
        

### **Name**: 
User friendly name for the app, subscribers will use this name to subscribe to the app's published events. It will be automatically fetched from dev portal. Listing-id of the app will be used as app name.

response.name: OK - The request succeeded.

query.description: uuid of next page
Number of items to return. Value should be between 1 to 50. Default is 20
App id of the app which registered events

Specifies list of attributes to be included in response with default attribute. If not specified, following attribute will be returned: name, description, type, appId, appName. 

**Note**: Event Name will be returned in app responses.

request.description:
Get events of the topic. By default it will return event's name, type, appId, appName (app which published this event) and description.

If you need to fetch additional fields, you can specify them in select query.

response.name: OK - The request succeeded.

header.description: (Required) App Id of the subscriber for which subscriptions are getting created.
(Required) User info header having JSON stringified object having following properties {"appId", "name", "id"}

request.description:
Create the subscription for the app

User will need to specify the topic Name, appId of the app which published this events and events that he wants to subscribe. 

**customAttr**: (default: false) If the user wants custom attributes to be sent as part of webhook payload, then he will need to set this flag.

**Note1**: Subscriber will only be created with customAttr=true only if subscribing app has access to the publisher app.

**Note2**: Max 5 subscribers are allowed per unique Event

response.name: OK - The request succeeded.

header.description: (Required) App Id of the subscriber for which subscriptions are getting created.
(Required) User info header having JSON stringified object having following properties {"appId", "name", "id"}

**Note**: If events are specified in update operation, existing events will be overridden. 
If specific events needs to be appended/removed use the PATCH api.

query.description: Execution Log date in YYYY-MM-DD format - if not provided will fallback to today (GMT)
uuid of next page
Execution Status - success / failed

request.description:
Get the subscriptions executions.

**Execution Storage and Expiry**:

  Executions are stored within the system and have a Time-to-Live (TTL) expiry set to 7 days. 
  This means that execution records older than 7 days are automatically removed from the storage. 
  
  When using the date query parameter, the endpoint retrieves executions within the specified date, keeping in line with the 7-day storage limit. 

  Max 20 executions logs can be fetching per request.

response.name: OK - The request succeeded.

(Required) User info header having JSON stringified object having following properties {"appId", "name", "id"}
